hypothesis_content.title: Regime Transition Failure at Key Moving Average
hypothesis_content.statement: When market attempts regime transition (price breaks key level with volume) but fails to hold above/below the 50-day SMA for 2 consecutive days, it will revert to previous regime with 80% probability, creating a fade opportunity.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Failed regime transitions often create powerful mean reversion moves. The 50-day SMA acts as a key institutional sentiment level. Failed breaks indicate lack of conviction, leading to sharp reversions.
entry_conditions: Price breaks key level (previous high/low) with >1.8x volume
Price fails to hold above (for BULL attempt) or below (for BEAR attempt) 50-day SMA for 2 days
RSI(14) shows divergence on failure (price makes new extreme but RSI doesn't)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price returns to previous regime range OR 5% move
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price confirms new regime with 3 consecutive closes beyond 50-day SMA

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Failed break leads to consolidation rather than reversion, or new regime establishes despite initial failure
